name: Pickled Strawberries
description: Unexpectedly delightful little pops of sweet vinegar-soaked strawberries on grilled sourdough with goat cheese, thyme, and honey!
keywords: pickled strawberries, strawberry recipe, strawberry crostini
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 cups halved strawberries (enough to fill a jar)
water to fill the rest of the jar
one or two 4-ounce packages goat cheese

recipeInstructions.text: Place the strawberries in a jar. Add the vinegar, sugar, peppercorns, and salt. Fill to the top with water. Secure the lid and shake gently to combine.
recipeInstructions.name: Pickled Strawberries

recipeInstructions.text: Place in the refrigerator for 2 hours, or up to 2 days. (I prefer these within the first 12-24 hours so they don’t get too mushy.)
recipeInstructions.name: Wait Time

recipeInstructions.text: Fry or grill the bread. I fry a few slices at a time in olive oil on my griddle until nice and golden and crispy. Smear the goat cheese on the toast and top with a few strawberries. Smash them gently with a fork. Sprinkle with bits of thyme, a drizzle of honey, and a hit of salt. Mwah!
recipeInstructions.name: For Serving

video.name: Pickled Strawberries
video.description: Unexpectedly delightful little pops of sweet vinegar-soaked strawberries on grilled sourdough with goat cheese, thyme, and honey!

review.reviewBody:
This sounds amazing...question though...
Can I use frozen strawberries for this recipe? 
These would be amazing on a salad..spinach, some feta crumbles, maybe some leftover rotisserie chicken  yum!!!
I had strawberries that I needed to use and I decided to try this. Super yummy and the peppercorns are a great pop!

Made this for my kids for breakfast and I asked him how many stars I should rate it and he said 1000. 

I bought honey flavored goat cheese since it has a honey drizzle which was perfect.

Not a big fan of berries but I realize their many benefits. Started buying little ‚Äúflats‚Äù of blueberries washing them & freezing them to use in a ‚Äúmash‚Äù if you will with lemon, ginger cinnamon & sometimes Turmeric blended together. Then I add flaxseed & or Chia seed for a mid morning snack. Saw your pickled strawberry recipe & thought I‚Äôd give it a try. WWWOOWW!! Whole new view of strawberries!! Love them pickled! Tomorrow I try your recipe with cheese etc. Truly enjoy all that you share!! Thank you for this!!

What a fun recipe! It has the potential to sound very strange, but I know that I can trust any recipe posted on this website! This is the perfect summer cocktail hour appetizer. It‚Äôs the best mix of creamy, crispy, tart, sweet‚Ä¶ so good! I‚Äôll definitely be making this over and over.
This was divine! I love the sweet and savory combo!

I have a dinner party coming up and saw this recipe and thought what a great idea, so I made it today as posted and could not wait for the 12 hour window üòè I had purchased the feta honey and had this foe my dinner tonight. I love it! did not have fresh thyme so used dry to see if I liked the flavor combo before I purchase fresh. 
I looking forward to how the flavors have melded tomorrow and I have some fresh mint to try with it.
I just purchased some fresh cherries and will try that next. Thank for a lovely simple idea.

I pickled cucumbers nearly a year and a half ago, using this method with the addition of boiling the jars in a large pot at a rolling boil for about 15 minutes. It seals the jar. I opened one a few days ago and they were fantastic.
What a unique and delightful recipe idea! Thank you for sharing this creative and easy-to-make recipe. Can't wait to try it out!

We‚Äôve been on a pizza kick this summer with our new pizza oven.  I used this as inspiration and we did a pickled strawberry pizza that was AMAZING! 
Thank you üçì ü§§

I am contacting you about a personal matter. I believe your husband cheated on you with my uncle. <3 <3
